utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How are you settling in?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Pretty well. Princeton has a beautiful campus.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, I’ve learned some fun facts about New Jersey to help you make small talk. Would you like to know the state bird or the murder rate? They’re both shocking.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Actually, I want to hear about you. How are things at home?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m a lot less likely to see an Eastern Goldfinch or be murdered, I’ll tell you that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I miss you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I miss you, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s so strange, earlier today I ended a sentence with a preposition and you weren’t there to correct my grammar.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry you had to go through that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: In fact, that’s when I started to really miss you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know you just split an infinitive.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did I? Are you gonna teach me a lesson?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am. It is naughty to put an adverb between the word to and the verb stem.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you gonna do about it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m going to admonish you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Vigorously?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s the only kind of admonishing I do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How’s Sheldon doing with Amy gone?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, the last three nights I’ve had to take him to get a haircut, to the train store, and to a Walgreens in Arcadia where they still have the good ibuprofen. Now ask me how I’m doing with Amy gone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How are you doing with…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you’d like, we can help you out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that would be great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I mean, not me, I’ve got a wife and child, but this one posts video of himself flossing on Instagram.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was a tutorial. And yes, I’m happy to keep Sheldon company.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. Tonight he wants to look at ladders at Home Depot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, why does he need a ladder?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He doesn’t; he just likes looking at them. Bring a book.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen. You may remember Dr. Nowitzki, She’s back at Caltech for her postdoc.

utterance.speaker: Ramona Nowitzki
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hi. Oh, let me bring a chair for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. Dr. Nowitzki’s going to tell me about the work she did at CERN. And she brought me this duty-free Toblerone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. I love those.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s sit somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A stranger just lured Sheldon away with a candy bar.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, isn’t she the grad student that used to follow him around?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Back before he hit puberty and grew man parts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So what do you guys think that’s about?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Knowing Sheldon, nothing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, tell me about your scalar dark energy experiment.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Not ’til you tell me about your latest paper on quantum loop theory.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. You must be one of those dessert before dinner people.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He just made her laugh, something’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you see the way she’s looking at him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Like Bernadette used to look at me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I keep telling you, close the bathroom door.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah, did you see that? She just touched his hand and he didn’t swat it away. What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, the simplest explanation is usually the right one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That ain’t Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not only did they eat together, Leonard said he made her laugh.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s nothing, Howie said she touched his hand.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did he Purell?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I cannot believe Leonard mentioned the Toblerone but left that part out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Should we call Amy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know; we shouldn’t worry her if it’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I guess we could wait till we have more information about this girl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you think living with Amy has somehow stirred up Sheldon’s sexual appetite?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ugh. How can you think that? Why would you even put those words together?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, then we agree. He’s not making any moves, it’s this Dr. Ramona chick.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nowitzki. I googled her, she’s pretty cute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? All I got from Leonard was the Toblerone bar had nuts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And get this, I saw an articulating ladder with dual-leg leveling, which delivers stability and adaptability to uneven terrain.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sounds like a big night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Raj made the funniest joke, he said, which is the best ladder to use to hang myself?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So you’re keeping busy? You’re not lonely?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, not at all. I’ve had outings with Leonard and Raj in the evening, and, oh, I had lunch

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who’s he?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Dr. Nowitzki is a woman.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Really? Uh, when did you meet her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Many years ago. Back when she was a grad student. She’s always been a huge fan of my work, and now she’s doing research at Caltech.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Huge fan, you say?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I think you’d like her. She’s extremely intelligent, just like you. Unlike you, she’s tall, blonde and used to be an Olympic swimmer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s terrific. I’ll call you right back.

utterance.speaker: Penny (answering skype)
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I gave you one job. Keep an eye on him. How hard is that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We thought you meant not letting him run out into traffic.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Which he only did once.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell me?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We didn’t want you to worry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Should I worry?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Come on, it’s Sheldon. Nothing is gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s what you said to me when I started dating him. And then five years later, bingo bango, something happened.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, but you’re gonna be back in three months.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You don’t get it. I’ve been smacking that ketchup bottle for a long time. All she’s got to do is tip it over and point it at her fries.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. Might be the New Jersey talking, but this Nowitzki broad needs to disappear.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. As far as we know, all that happened is two scientists had lunch.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, but one of those scientists is a tall, blonde Olympic swimmer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on. Looks don’t matter to Sheldon. Because he only has eyes for you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Nice try.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. I was scrambling.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s unbelievable. Sheldon has lunch with another woman and somehow my wife yells at me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny laid into me, too. Apparently, I’m overly fixated on premium Swiss chocolate bars.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can you even eat those things?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If I take a Lactaid a half-hour before and some Pepto right after.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sounds like a lot of work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Eh, I’m worth it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Guys. Focus. Should we do something about Nowitzki?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, well, she’s single, so if somebody else asks her out and she says yes, then we know she’s not into Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No offence, Stuart, but the woman’s a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So? Doctors like me. Whenever I see mine he calls in a bunch of other doctors to have a look.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s not that kind of doctor.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh. Well, her loss. I’ve been called a genuine medical oddity.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, I was going to suggest me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Anybody’s better than, mmm.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Excuse me. They took out my spleen and gallbladder, not my feelings.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dr. Nowitzki. Good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Good to see you, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: May I join you?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should call Guinness, that might be a record.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s clearly having a working lunch and preferred to eat alone.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper, over here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I could have made her very happy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You kept walking. I think you did.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you really think there’s reason to worry?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s definitely going after Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I made a play for her and she shot me down.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, that doesn’t prove anything.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, there’s a million reasons a woman would shoot Raj down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like, really, a million?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fine, hundreds.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The point is this could be nothing and we are all overreacting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, everybody. This is my friend, Dr. Nowitzki.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We just went swimming.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you actually got in a pool?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was scared, but I told myself it’s just a big bathtub. Then I got scared again ’cause there are all these strangers in my bathtub.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I was proud of him, a lot of people don’t put their face in the water on the first day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I was hiding from a bee, but it still counts.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can I just squeeze in here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, Sheldon, have you talked to Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, we skyped this morning and I’m sure I’ll check in with her before I go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Sheldon talks about her all the time. I can’t wait to meet her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is true. She keeps asking how long Amy’s going to be gone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, so, Ramona, tell us about yourself. Do you, do you have a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, your wife is sitting right here. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: No, my work doesn’t leave me a lot of time for relationships.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think you made that very clear.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She was part of the American team at CERN.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I had a front row seat when they detected the Higgs boson.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you know, I’ve corresponded with Peter Higgs. Would you like to see some of his letters?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll get them.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Well, hang on, I’ll come with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, fun. Like a play date.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, correct me if I’m wrong, but isn’t that exactly what we were supposed to stop from happening?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I threw my body at them, what else did you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You think you should call Amy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You got fingers and a mouth, you call her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Are these all from Peter Higgs?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm? Oh, no, no, no. They’re from many famous people. See? Oh, like this one. This is from Patrick Stewart. It says if I come to his house again, I get to meet his dogs. Oh, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, hello, Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was missing you again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I miss you, too. Hey, this is good timing. Remember that Dr. Nowitzki I told you about? She’s right here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She’s what?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: So nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Hang on. Hello. A little late, Leonard. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is Leonard doing calling you at this hour?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s not important.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I must tell you, that seems a little inappropriate. Don’t you agree?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See? We both think so.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, this is making me crazy. Somebody’s got to go over there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You got feet and legs, you do it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Will you go with me?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: To do what? Shake a can of nickels at them?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’re being ridiculous. There’s no way a woman that attractive is trying to seduce Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You done trying to make yourself feel better?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. I haven’t played the race card yet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, I hate to break up the party, but Amy says I’m tired and have to go to bed.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: It was nice seeing everybody. Thank you for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Our pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Walk me to my car?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’ll all go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Pardon. I just need to., yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was fun. It was like Mario Kart.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? Is this about Leonard and Amy? I don’t like it either.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I know you don’t have a lot of experience with women, but Ramona seems to have a romantic interest in you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. She knows I have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, sometimes women don’t care. Sometimes it makes them want a guy even more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That may be true, but Dr. Nowitzki’s just a friend. In fact, I wouldn’t have even noticed she’s a woman if she hadn’t worn that bathing suit that highlighted her bosom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Um, let’s try this. Think of yourself as one of those limited edition toys people like to collect.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I already do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, then you get it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because there’s only one of me, I’m more valuable.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Although, Amy’s already taken me out of my package and played with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Let’s forget the toy thing, okay? Um, maybe…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, look. I appreciate your concern, but I don’t think that’s what’s happening.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. What do you think is happening?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think Dr. Nowitzki is a friendly colleague. I think you and Leonard need to see a marriage counsellor. And I need to update my résumé to include swimming as a special skill.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t look at me like that, I tried.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Hey, did you eat yet?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, breakfast yes, lunch no. I did have a cough drop, but that really rides the line between sucking and eating.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Well, perfect. I made us sandwiches.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How thoughtful. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: Mmm. No big deal, I enjoy spending time with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I with you. Question, are you seeking a romantic relationship with me?

utterance.speaker: Ramona
utterance.content: What if I were?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that would raise a number of problems. We’re colleagues. I’m currently in a relation… Excuse me a moment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy. Amy. Amy. Will you marry me?
